content:
@WG-prioritization/alerts issue #84075 has been requested for prioritization.

Procedure

  • Priority?
  • Regression?
  • Notify people/groups?
  • Needs I-nominated?
nightly-only but is unsoundness, so I thought it could be worth prioritizing.
P-high, I think. P-critical would be okay too.
This is nightly-only, so I don't think it should be P-critical.

@Camelid I agree. What's the status of the auto_traits issue (#13231)? At a cursory look, it seems to proceed slowly, so I thought a P-medium for this issue?
My rationale is: even if we assign a P-high it would be blocked anyway by #13231. So I'd say a P-medium to keep it on the radar
(makes sense?)

P-high seems like a better fit to me, but I think P-medium is close enough. The reasons I would suggest P-high is that it is unsoundness and could be triggered by a small mistake in the code, and the feature is used in the standard library. But, I think all of the uses in the standard library are as marker traits that have no where clauses.
@Camelid makes totally sense, thanks for the details. I'd rather err on the caution side and agree on a p-high (and maybe only later downgrade if that's the case)
